w:r.w:t: The abstract should summarize the contents of the paper
below the author information. Use the word
as the title, in 12-point Times New Roman, boldface type,
centered relative to the column, initially capitalized
, fixed-spacing at 13 pt., 12 pt. spacing before
. All manuscripts must be in English
as the title, in 10-point Times New Roman, boldface, initially capitalized, italicized,
-6 keywords for a subject index should be included
Keywords must be 10-point Times New Roman, italicized,
. Leave 11-point one single space after keywords, then begin Introduction.
refer to this document and follow the specifics
These guidelines include complete descriptions of the fonts, spacing, and related
manuscripts. Please follow them and if you have any questions, direct them to the person in
The copyright form may be downloaded from the Information for Authors->Submit your Manuscript webpage:
Please send your signed copyright form
, as scanned pdf. The lead author may sign on behalf of all of the other authors of a particular paper. Digital signatures are acceptable.
Font of the paper title must be in 14-p
oint Times New Roman, boldfaced, centered,
Leave 2 spaces after the paper title in 11-point, then type author/s name/s. Author/s name/s must be in
Please mark the corresponding author with
Leave 1 space after the author/s name/s in 12-point
zed, centered, and fixed-spacing at 13 pt.
s e-mail/s at the following line with same specifics.
and charts, must be kept within the parameters of the
Please do not write or print outside of the column parameters. Margins are
Italic type may be used to emphasize words in running text. Bold type and underlining should be avoided.
Leave a space between word and parenthesis. Special words of Latin or French origin should be in italic (
Be sure your text is fully justified-that is, flush left and flush right.
Please be noted that the first line of the paragraph indent is 0.5cm.
The recommended format and the capitalization styles of major headings are as follows: Abstract,
Keywords, INTRODUCTION, THEORY, EXPERIMENTS, RESULTS AND DISCUSSION, CONCLUSION,

Headings should be capitalized (i.e., nouns, verbs, and all other words except articles, prepositions, and conjunctions should be set with an initial capital) and should, with the exception of the title, be aligned to the left. Words joined by a hyphen are subject to a special rule.
f the first word can stand alone, the second word should be capitalized.
Please refer to the following when submitting your manuscript.
Table captions should always be positioned
the tables, in 11-point Helvetica, boldfaced, centered, single-spaced, 6pt. spacing after the text. The contents of the table must be in 10-point Helvetica. Please leave a space after the table.
Grids and details within the figures
must be clearly legible and may not be written one on top of the other.
Figures should be numbered and should have a caption which should always be positioned
the figures, in contrast to the caption belonging to a table, which should always appear
the table. Please center the captions between the margins and set them in
figure and caption should be about 6 pt, and the distance between caption and
Please be noted that illustrations are black an

in the electronic version. If you send colored figures that are to be printed in black and white, please make sure that they really are legible in black and white. Some colors show up very poorly when printed in black and white.
he SI system should be used for all dimensional quantities. Leave a space between numbers and units except oC and % (e.g., 40 mg/L, 50%, 10 h).
Main symbols used in equations and text should be in italic. Equations must be numbered consecutively using Arabic numbers.
Acknowledgement title is not numbered. Type the acknowledgement in this format
This work was supported by (institution to

References to published work should be indicated at the appropriate place using brackets (e.g.,[2,6-8]), numbered consecutively, and a list of references in numerical order should be provided at the end of the manuscript. Sources of materials and instruments should be clearly presented together with the names of the appropriate cities and countries.
All references in this list should be cited at some point in the text. Abbreviate the journal titles as in IEEE Abstracts. References should be presented in the following
H.M. Kwon, V. Kumaran, and S. Gupta, “A New Broadcast Scheduling Scheme,”
The Journal of the Institute of Internet, Broadcasting and Communication(JIIBC)
M. Franklin and S. Zdonik, “A Framework for Scalable Dissemination-Based Systems,” in
A Study of Acetic Acid Formation in Escherichia coli Fermentation,
Ph.D. Thesis. University of California, Irvine, CA, USA., 2010.
Prudden, J. F., Method and agent for treating inflammatory disorders of the gastrointestinal tract.
The Institute of Internet, Broadcasting and Communication, Submission of manuscript.
Note: Manuscripts in which references are not in this format will be returned without review.
ference must begin in numbering system such as [1],[2], and so on.
Reference title is not numbered, and written in 13-point Times New Roman, boldfaced, single-spaced,
references must be written in 10-point Times New Roman
Wansik Kim, “Development of W-band Transceiver Module using Manufactured MMIC”, The Journal of The Institute of Internet, Broadcasting and Communication(JIIBC), Vol. 17, No. 2, pp. 233-237, Apr 2017.
B. Sklar, Digital Communications, Prentice Hall, pp. 187, 1998.
M. Franklin and S. Zdonik, “A Framework for Scalable Dissemination-Based Systems,” in Proc. 9th IEE SP Workshop on Statistical Signal, pp. 232-235, Sep.14-16, 2008.
Han, K., A Study of Acetic Acid Formation in Escherichia coli Fermentation, Ph.D. Thesis. University of California, Irvine, CA, USA., 2010.
Prudden, J. F., Method and agent for treating inflammatory disorders of the gastrointestinal tract.
The Institute of Internet, Broadcasting and Communication, Submission of manuscript.
